issues.description: The method signature for addParent is inconsistent: the problem statement and template specify addParent(Person, Person) returns a Person, but the solution’s PersonService implements addParent with a void return type. This mismatch will cause compilation errors in PersonResource where the return value is assigned to a Person.
issues.suggested_fix: Change the solution’s addParent method to return a Person. For example, update its signature to `public Person addParent(Person person, Person parent)` and return `personRepository.save(person)` at the end.

issues.description: The problem statement refers to REST endpoints with an `/api` prefix (e.g., `PUT /api/persons/{personId}/parents`), but both the template and solution code define these mappings without `/api` (e.g., `@PutMapping("persons/{personId}/parents")`). This misalignment may confuse students when trying to follow the instructions against the actual code and tests.
issues.suggested_fix: Either update the code to include the `/api` prefix on all mappings (for example, add `@RequestMapping(path = "/api", ...)` at the class level) or revise the problem statement to remove the `/api` prefix so that it matches the actual endpoint paths.
